messages.subject: Re: Homeschool theater groups
messages.msgSnippet: Seems to me there was someone on the UL or HEM-Networking who had kids that had set up their own theater group. Lynda ... From: Strandbe@aol.com ... (all ...
messages.messageBody:
Seems to me there was someone on the UL or HEM-Networking who had kids that
had set up their own theater group.

Lynda

----------
From: Strandbe@...
>
> In the text of the letter by Peggy Griffin I noticed this:
>
> <<My sons both participate in theatre class with 2 productions each year
(all
> of the cast members are also home educated).>>
>
> Very interesting to me, since we began a homeschool community theater
group
> about five years ago. We also do two productions a year and all our cast

> membrs are homeschooled. In fact, we're hard at work
rehearsing/preparing
> for our next show which opens (gulp) THIS week.
>
> Are there other hs theater groups out there that anyone knows of (I
> correspond with a great woman in Wash. D.C. who has had a group for a
long
> time)? It would be fun to start a loop or at least exchange some
> information....
>
> Susan--Theatrix, Homeschool Community Theater
>
> > Message boards, timely articles, a free newsletter and more!
> Check it all out at: http://www.unschooling.com

messages.subject: Homeschool theater groups
messages.msgSnippet: In the text of the letter by Peggy Griffin I noticed this:
messages.messageBody:
In the text of the letter by Peggy Griffin I noticed this:

<<My sons both participate in theatre class with 2 productions each year (all
of the cast members are also home educated).>>

Very interesting to me, since we began a homeschool community theater group
about five years ago. We also do two productions a year and all our cast
membrs are homeschooled. In fact, we're hard at work rehearsing/preparing
for our next show which opens (gulp) THIS week.

Are there other hs theater groups out there that anyone knows of (I
correspond with a great woman in Wash. D.C. who has had a group for a long
time)? It would be fun to start a loop or at least exchange some
information....

Susan--Theatrix, Homeschool Community Theater
